column4: Needing some quick help on piping a terminal command am entering into a file.. something like "echo hello world! | >~/test.txt"
also i think 'echo "hello world" | cat >> ~/somefile' works as well, no?
nah...the cat command after the piper gives a "Broken Piper" error.... but the others have wroked... special echo "text" >> file... as it appends a new line
